snippet: Even when suspected illegal fishermen are caught, penalties can be elusive, as two recent cases in Sierra Leone and Costa Rica show.
abstract: Even when suspected illegal fishermen are caught, penalties can be elusive, as two recent cases in Sierra Leone and Costa Rica show.
lead_paragraph: Illegal fishing is a problem pretty much everywhere that regulations meet fish. As I noted in September, the United States government puts the global cost of illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing at up to $23 billion in lost income for legal fishermen and coastal communities. And that's before the larger environmental costs are considered.
